boardgame.name: Crush Depth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Players take on the role of ruthless bounty hunters, desperate prisoners, or prison guards in way over their heads, all of whom are trying to escape the collapsing prison of Crush Mare.

Crush Mare is a maximum-security prison located deep below Titan’s methane sea, Kraken Mare. The worst criminals in the sector are kept here - mass murderers, serial killers, and political prisoners.

Tectonic activity on Titan was thought to be non-existent...until today. A massive 8.5 earthquake has rocked the facility and sent the prison into total anarchy. Life support has been destroyed beyond repair. Liquid methane is pouring in at every crack. Fires have broken out across the prison and are spreading rapidly.

Prisoners are rioting. Communication with the surface has been lost. The only escape sub is locked behind a biometric key, and the only non-pulverized guard with biometric access hasn’t been seen since the quake. Guards and prisoners are racing against one another to find the Keyed Guard and escape. To worsen matters, bounty hunters have arrived on-scene to transport two highly dangerous criminals from the facility, Edmund and Brace. They will do whatever it takes to escape the prison alive with their bounty, while Edmund and Brace will do anything and everything to prevent their own capture.

Start a timer, because in two hours, the entire facility will implode under the pressure of Titan’s Kraken Mare...


The front page includes a map, timeline of events without player intervention, roll tables for generating prison & guard motivations, disasters as the facility crumbles around the players, equipment, and (of course) an encounter table. The back page includes pregame generation rules, tips for running Crush Depth, NPC stats, and some notes on how to handle liquid methane when it comes into contact with characters, oxygen, and/or fire.

boardgame.name: Seize the Bean: Quality Beasts Customer Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
The Quality Beast Customer Group is a mish-mash of other Customer Groups with diverse requirements and abilities. The cards feature Quality Beast staff and Quality Beast related upgrades.

10 customers, 5 products, 5 upgrades, 1 customer award / cheat sheet card, and 1 promotional card

boardgame.name: Seize the Bean: Board Game Media Customer Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
The Board Game Media Customer Group is a mish-mash of other Customer Groups with diverse requirements and abilities. The cards feature board game reviewers and board game related upgrades.

10 customer cards, 5 upgrade cards, 5 product cards, 1 customer award token.

boardgame.name: Toxic People
boardgame.description:
It looks like poker ... it feels like poker ... but this poker is toxic!

Toxic People combines a unique blend of draw poker and action cards to bring office politics to a whole new level. You'll need a combination of luck and strategy to emerge the winner in this easy-to-learn party game for 2 to 6 players.

Beat your opponents with a winning hand in a classic game of draw poker. Just don't get too comfortable as a bad bunch of action cards like the cheater and troublemaker are going to mess things up!

You even get to draft the action cards that will be played during the game. Choose the bluffer card if deception turns you on. Choose more sabotage cards (like the bully) if you like to undermine your buddies. Every game can be customized so you'll need different strategies to win.

After the mayhem caused by the action cards, the winner will get to pass the loser a toxic token. The first player with 3 toxic tokens is crowned the loser!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Uncommon Origins: New Backgrounds For 5e
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“This world is full of shadows. Plenty of them lurk around corners and skulk around dungeons waiting for you to wander into them, but the worst of the lot always seem to be stretching from a long ways behind you.”
- Garena Hillsworn, child hero of Ebonsong, slayer of the Horned Horror

Every epic tale of bravery or villainy begins with the humble start of its characters. The farmhand who drops their pitchfork to pick up their blade. The pickpocket who abandons their streets for dungeons. The young lord who seeks something far beyond their name and title. No matter how grand the adventure or shocking the twist and turns may be, the beginnings of these tales are often very familiar.

But there are those adventurers who come from more uncommon origins. Champions frozen in time and revived in an unknown world. Travelers from distant lands who crossed the borders of planes rather than countries. Former villains clinging to the chance of redemption. While these beginnings may not be well known, the heroes that spring from them are sure to make their marks on history.

This supplement includes the following backgrounds:


Adventurer From Afar - You're a traveler from another world.
Awakened Being - You were once a something. Now you're a someone.
Born Under A Bad Sign - You were marked by a strange omen.
Child Hero - You entered the world of heroes too soon.
Dream Chaser - You were given great dreams of adventure.
Fallen Jester - You fought against the aristocracy and lost.
Frozen Champion - You're a hero removed from your time.
Lone Survivor - You were the only survivor of a terrible tragedy.
Redemption Seeker - You're a former villain trying to pay your debts.
Wild-Raised - You were raised by beasts.

boardgame.name: Grand Austria Hotel: Deluxe Upgrade Pack
boardgame.description: The Deluxe Upgrade Pack upgrades the components and iconography of the base game to match the Deluxe Edition.

boardgame.name: Wim Thoelke's Pfiffi Quiz
boardgame.description:
A trivia card game with questions about sports. The 100 question/answer cards are additionally provided with plus and minus points. Whoever answers a question correctly receives the card (1 plus point) and the points indicated on the card. Players who already know the game can thus avoid answering questions with minus points.
The winner is the player who scores the most points in total.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Fox Matters: Heart of Cheese
boardgame.description: This expansion introduces 36 new nightmares to defeat, some of which add extra cards to the other decks.

boardgame.name: Das lustige Apfelpflücken
boardgame.description:
Each player is assigned a tree that bears 4 ripe apples. The first player to harvest his tree wins the game. Whoever's turn it is rolls a color die and moves an apple. You may only move if you roll the color of your corner, one square ahead. If there are four players, everyone moves to their left neighbor. In the tree itself the apples are not moved. If the player rolls brown, he may move an apple from his tree to his left neighbor's tree, if he rolls black, he takes an apple completely out of the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Göbeklitepe Ancient Board Game
boardgame.description:
Göbeklitepe, which has a sacred consciousness, bears the traces of productivity culture. In addition, it is the oldest known cult building group with its beliefs about death and rebirth, the belief that there is life after death, and compositions applied on stones.

My work is an ancient board game consisting of t-columns, animal drawings, figures and the mythical meanings of symbols, which play an important role in the building art of this sacred area.

Reaching the Central Zone of the game with the T-Column, obtaining the Central T Arm and being the first to reach the U-Stone Gate again.

The first player to enter the buildings from the Building Entrances and obtain the Central T-Column in the Center Area and return to the U-Stone Gate wins. Or, the first player to return to the U-Stone Gate by making mandatory entry to all structures, obtaining the Central T-Pillar located in the Center Area, wins.

Figures, T-Pillars and Center T-Pillars were hand modeled in polymer clay as the closest miniature replica.

boardgame.name: 铁底湾的回响 (Iron Bottom Sound IV)
boardgame.description: Iron Bottom Sound IV is a tactical simulation of night naval surface combat in WW2.

boardgame.name: Gordon Greenfee Golfgame
boardgame.description:
Players roll their piece (tee) across a golf course and complete the 18 holes. For this, 3 different dice are used (Normal: values 1, 2, 3; Putting: Values 1 and 2; Handicap: Values 1, 2, 3 and 3 events). In addition, there are event fields on which event cards must be drawn. The player who has needed the fewest strokes after completing all holes wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Lese-Domino
boardgame.description:
4 different reading dominoes in different difficulty levels to learn to read.


20 cards where you have to pay attention to certain initial letters.
20 cards with riddles.
20 cards with search words.
20 cards with additional sentences.


Here not only the mechanical reading is trained, but above all the sense-comprehending reading.
Only those who read correctly will find the right card!

The cards of a game are shuffled and distributed to the players. Now the cards have to be placed in such a way that the words or texts match the pictures of the previous card or vice versa... The first to lay down his domino cards wins the game.

boardgame.name: Hostage Negotiator: Complete Collector Edition
Négociateur Prise d'Otages: Edition Collector Intégrale
boardgame.description:
The complete set of the famous solitaire game Hostage Negotiator, in a complete edition including the base game and all its expansions.

Contents of the box:


The base game Hostage Negotiator in its original box
Crime Wave Expansion
The first 8 expansions
A unique expansion set! (also available in the classic Crime Wave box).

listing.notes:
Hostage Negotiator Full Set incl.
Crime Wave Career unopend Abductor Packs 1 to 10 Abductor Meeple and all Kickstarter inklusivs.
90% of the cards are sleeved.

boardgame.name: Deutschland Rummy
boardgame.description:
The popular tile-laying game RUMMY, now in a German version! As in the famous classic, each player tries to get rid of his tiles as quickly as possible, but in this version, each tile shows a connection between two cities from the German rail network.
From Rostock to Berlin it is 227 km and then on to Potsdam, or rather to Wolfsburg? The player whose turn it is tries to use his tiles to lay routes and to rebuild already played routes in order to get rid of tiles from his own supply.
This creates city connections throughout the entire rail network. Only the first player to get rid of his tiles can win the game!

—user summary

boardgame.name: Lustige Quatschrätsel
boardgame.description:
A trivia card game with humorous answers. The questions are read aloud. Whoever knows the answer gets the question card. Whoever has collected 5 question cards wins. The peculiarity of the game is that the answers require creative word creations. For example, the correct answer to the question "What swims in the sea and can calculate?" is "Octo-plus". As a support, the question cards are illustrated and shown to the guessers.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Baby Shark Party at the Reef Game
boardgame.description: Work together to get Baby, Mommy, and Daddy Shark to the party on Coral Reef. But hurry before the seaweed storm washes everything away. Roll the die and then press the button to determine how many spaces you get the move the Shark and which Shark you get to roll. But be careful, roll a seaweed and you are one step closer to ending the game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups

boardgame.name: Marvel Champions: Das Kartenspiel – Szenario-Pack The Hood
Marvel Champions: El Juego de Cartas – The Hood Pack de Escenario
Marvel Champions: Il Gioco di Carte – The Hood: Pack Scenario
Marvel Champions: Le Jeu de Cartes – The Hood
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – The Hood Scenario Pack
boardgame.description:
Ever since he witnessed a battle between Electro and Daredevil as a child, the life of a supervillain was enticing to Parker Robbins. Later, while stealing money to pay for his mother’s medical care, a chance encounter with a demon left Robbins with a pair of boots that let him walk on air and an equally-mystical red cloak. Now, as the Hood, Robbins and his budding criminal empire are swiftly becoming a formidable threat to the people of New York City.

This 78-card scenario pack introduces a new scenario to Marvel Champions showcasing the Hood and his notorious organization of supervillains. Also included are a whopping nine modular encounter sets that can be mixed in with any scenario—including the Hood’s—to add more customization options to your Marvel Champions experience. Are you prepared to take down a dangerous criminal empire?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects: Deluxe Edition – Magnets Set
boardgame.description:
A set of 26 magnets to help you further stabilize your Palace, especially thought for Architects very concerned with the Palace stability... or with very clumsy gaming friends!

Content:

26 magnets (1.1 cm x 0.4 cm x 0.4 cm)
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects: Deluxe Edition

boardgame.name: Lockup: A Roll Player Tale – Acrylic Tiles
boardgame.description:
Add a set of 35 plastic acrylic tiles with heat transfer images of all crew members to upgrade your copy of Lockup!


Replaces the cardboard crew tiles included in the game with hard acrylic plastic versions.
Supports both the base game and the Breakout expansion.
Fancy metallic silver printing on the back of all tiles.
Fits well on the "holding cell" tile holders from the base game.

listing.notes:
NEW!
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.

boardgame.name: Burgle Bros 2: Playmat
boardgame.description:
This is 1 additional neoprene playmat from Burgle Bros 2. This enables players to make 3 floor layouts. Include lines for room placements. Also works with Burgle Bros.

-Description from publisher

boardgame.name: Unmatched: The Brothers Murph – The Unofficial Official Set
boardgame.description:
This is a fan made deck for Unmatched featuring The Brothers Murph as a playable Hero that will be fully compatible with all Unmatched sets. This is not a Restoration Games or Mondo Games product but was given the blessing of Restoration Games and has been given guidance on design by their team and will be produced through Game Crafter during The Brothers Murph's Kickstarter Campaign

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Unmatched: Battle of Legends, Volume One
Unmatched: Battle of Legends, Volume Two
Unmatched: Jurassic Park – Dr. Sattler vs. T. Rex
Unmatched: Jurassic Park – InGen vs Raptors
Unmatched: Little Red Riding Hood vs. Beowulf

boardgame.name: Backgrounds in the Kingdom of Grimsby
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Looking for new backgrounds? These are 6 new homebrewed backgrounds that were featured in the character sheets in the Bremen Town-Musicians, but can be incorporated into any 5e character sheet:


Farmer
Forest Dweller
Hunter
Messenger
Royal Heir
Street Performer


These were originally made for animals, but were generalized for all races and characters.

boardgame.name: 13th Age Quick Start Rules
boardgame.description: From the 13th Age Humble Bundle: "Quickly learn the 13th Age RPG, and play epic adventures in a world where mighty Icons war and scheme in a tense balance of power. Download the SRD if you're interested in developing original new material using the Archmage Engine rules."

boardgame.name: Die Reise durch den Schwarzwald
boardgame.description: The players start at space 1 (Karlsruhe). The first to reach space 62 (Stuttgart) wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

boardgame.name: Pinocchio
boardgame.description:
The board features an outline of six characters from the story of Pinocchio (pre-Disney). Players spin the spinner and try to collect the 6 pieces they need to cover the character outline on the boards. The spinner has a combination of colors and character icons. If the arrow points to a character icon, you can add a piece to your character's outline on the board. If the arrow lands on a color, then you receive a joker tile of that color. If that color is spun again on a future turn, the person holding that color joker tile gets to add a piece to their character's outline on the board. The joker tile is returned to the pool.

The first person to complete their character, wins.

listing.notes:
first Edition, German version, © 1977 by ???
Unfortunately there is no rule.

boardgame.name: Road Trippin
boardgame.description:
This is a Vanity License Plate Word Game for Competitive People. Create and Solve Custom Vanity Plates in a Race Across Country

Players will draw a card containing a phrase and have to convert that phrase into a license plate. Then, depending on the game mode (Team Vs, Cooperative, or FFA) other players will guess what the phrase says. A point is scored for guessing a plate correctly as well as additional points for using numbers and having unused blank spaces at the end of the plate. Points are scored on a race track with cars representing the players/teams. First car to complete their road trip wins!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Road Trippin: After Dark Expansion Pack

listing.notes: Title: Road Trippin Publisher: Guilt Free Gaming Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Coatl: A kártyajáték
Cóatl: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
A temple in honor of the gods has just been erected in the heart of an Aztec city. The walls inside this place of worship are to be decorated with paintings of feathered snakes to pay tribute to the gods. An election will be held to determine who is the empire’s most celebrated Cóatl painter so that they may have the honor of decorating the temple walls.

Can you prove your worth?
In Cóatl The Card Game, players try to paint the most beautiful and valuable serpent they can. The serpent (or Cóatl) is made up of a Head, a Tail and 8 Body cards.

During their turn, players will play 2 cards to create, then claim, any available patterns on the Prophecy cards. If you complete a Prophecy card that has already been claimed by another player, you will steal it and display it in front of you. You score more points if you create the same pattern multiple times and you may eventually be able to protect that Prophecy card so that it can no longer be stolen.

One game lasts 5 rounds. Players can earn additional victory points if they fulfill the requirements listed on a Temple card. When the last player completes their Cóatl, the player with the most victory points wins.

Cóatl The Card Game also has a solo mode and includes the Golden Feathers expansion, which is compatible with the Cóatl base game!

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Card Versions of Non-Card Games

boardgame.name: Shit Happens: Shitty ways to die
boardgame.description:
Stand-alone expansion to Shit Happens base game.

Alas, everyday fellow peers die! But they sometimes put so much creativity into dying, that they become dead legends! Thus, proving that the IQ of man may be lower than an oyster's.

Rank the dumbest dearths on the special scale of fail: the Stupid-O-Meter!

Correctly guess the Fail Index of cards to win them.

The first player to collect 10 cards wins.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Shit Happens: Too Shitty for Work
Shit Happens: Too Shitty for Work

listing.notes: Title: Shit Happens - Shitty Ways To Die Publisher: Goliath Language(s): English

boardgame.name: King of Tokyo: Dark Edition – Promo Cards for 2nd edition
boardgame.description:
A set of three promo cards for the Second Edition of King of Tokyo packaged in the Dark Edition. These cards have 2nd edition backs.

They only exist in French.

Here are the translations of the powers:

ADN Instable : When you run away from Tokyo, you can exchange this card with a card that belongs to the monster who hurt you.

Bond Fantastique : At your turn, you can spend 1 flash to cancel the loss of 1 heart (you can use it only once/round).

Bouclier réfléchissant : Monsters who hurt you lose 1 heart.

listing.notes:
New in shrink.
Will ship worldwide but contact me to know the shipping price (it should be around 5€).

boardgame.name: Flush
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Flush is a game forged in the crucible of class conflict. It is designed for four players, who take the role of an important figure from either the upper or lower class of a supremely stratified city—a city steeped in sin, a city without heroes, a city on the verge of war. Think of it like Sin City if the good guys never showed up.

User summary:

Flush combines a card game with elements of roleplaying roleplaying.

boardgame.name: Horrible Company
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

... A world filled with the strangest creatures your mind can fathom, all so human but completely incapable of seeing each other as such so consumed by their petty and bizarre fixations and en endless parade of lies.

... where the government’s role in torturing its citizens has progressed to a stunning art form.

... Where no mistakes are made, and if anyone questions it they're left alone on a volcanic island for a good length of time.

... Where a friend is someone you can trust to not modify your body to create a fascinating melody when you walk. At least it used to be.

... Somewhere so alien and bizarre that its most basic assumptions astounds you, but more and more every day, you cannot escape the fear that you have somehow built it.

boardgame.name: Jackknife
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You fell asleep at work again.

But this time, you fell into another world. Some sort of enchanted forest, from the looks of it. A bent old oak tree broke your fall, and he's not too happy about it. According to the tree, there were two of you. Except the other "you" was cooler, better looking, and much better dressed.

Must have been your dark side.

User summary:

Jackknife combines board game style play with roleplaying elements.

boardgame.name: Killin' Kthuloo
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Great KTHULOO is sick of nappin' in his house beneath the sea and is rising in London. London is a small town in England (pronounced ing-GER-land), and you take the role of tourists in this once great nation. Can you rise to the challenge? Can you save the Queen? Can America once again save England from her foes?

User summary:

Killin' Kthuloo combines board game play with roleplaying elements.

boardgame.name: Mad Escape!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In Mad Escape! you and your friends play crazy people who have just escaped the asylum. These crazy people all have very serious delusions about the world and themselves. So one person might believe himself to be a giant hairy monster from another dimension in search of true love, another might believe himself a floating hyper empathic eyeball and so on. One thing these people do have in common though, is that each of them believe they have some duty or obligation to fulfill - they are each of them on a quest. This quest, of course, has very little to do with anything any sane person would understand and indeed few or no similarities exists from each persons quest to the next.

boardgame.name: Messiah: A Game of Politicking in the Age of Spiritual Upheaval
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It is a time of great turmoil. The Scriptures foretold the coming of one who would cause great change. The Scriptures were correct.

There were three Signs that Messiah would arrive. Three miracles that only a true savior could perform. All three miracles were performed.

The Messiah is here. How will you react?
boardgame.rpg: Messiah: A Game of Politicking in the Age of Spiritual Upheaval

boardgame.name: MoobleBall in Hell!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

"Welcome to Hell.

"Please ensure you have all documentation completed in triplicate, unless you qualify under sub-categories 12a - 486c in which cases documentation must be chiseled into eighteen pieces of virgin flesh. Staff are to filter through lanes equal to a prime factor of limbs they possess, in many case the head is counted as a limb (and liable for vorpal re-assignment - refer to Oswald's grimoire of irrelevant occultisms vol 13 chapter XX - second edition) but tentacles of less than four groteenths are not considered limbs. A total tentacle mass of one cameron plus helf a furloin does constitute a singular limb. Sinners must bring completed portfolios of sins (approved to CDA standards) and hypothetical sin sheets of sins you might have committed given the choice. Also inform the staff of your religious preferences and we will do our level best to completely destroy your twatish belief system. We do really really genuinely care about all the denizens of Hell and hope your stay is as comfortable as possible. If you are still reading this then you have transgressed, breaching the Styxian boundary without a A47 permit or hades swipe-card. Return to limbo and await entry with the next soul influx, it's scheduled for late next millennium.

"Toodles!"

User summary:

MoobleBall in Hell! combines a board game with light roleplaying elements.

boardgame.name: Negativity
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A young mother paws through the children’s section, looking for a good deal on summer shorts for her eight-year old. As she shops she sees something move out of the corner of her eye—a humanoid torso where none should be. She turns quickly, but the shadow escapes her, returning to wherever it is these shadows go. In a dimension opposite the world of light, a world of dark is waiting….

This is Shadowland, and you are a shadow trying to survive in a crime-infested world of dark shifty characters. Three major factions control the light of the world and—depending on whose side you are on—you are either the hunted or the hunter.

boardgame.name: Ocean
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Plant roots are really in the ocean.

Metaphor for what the Ocean is like and how it compares to the real world in the introduction that I probably will not have time to write. The real world is rooted in the Ocean and controlling the Ocean so Swimmers in the Ocean can control the real world. Plus the ocean moves stuff around.

User summary:

The submitted game document notes it is not complete.

boardgame.name: Of Lice and Men
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A role-playing game of making your way in a world overrun by giant insects and social bigotry.
...

Hi, my name's Elab - Elab Smeth. I suppose you want to know about my life? Father said you would, so I'll do my best to describe what happens around here. We live in a house in Sanctuary. It's got lots of floors and it's very narrow, like all the houses here. I should probably tell you that Sanctuary is a city but it's not like the cities from way back in history because it's all built on the back of an enormous bug. Well, it's a louse really but we call them bugs. It walks around by itself and father says that's why our weather is so unpredictable. Sometimes they have to make it change direction though and father helps with that. He has to use Science.*

boardgame.name: Oneironaut: The Dream-Cop RPG
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

[Excerpt: Der Speigel International, 2 Feb]
HU Berlin Professor Unlocks Dreams
....Professor Daldis believes his device will allow psychiatrists to enter a patient's dreams and speak directly to the unconscious mind. .... Professor Daldis has great expectations for his device, which is now in the prototype stage.

[Excerpt: National Intelligence Report 23 Dec.]
The Agency did not consider the work of Dr. Daldis at the Humboldt-Universitaet zu Berlin to be of any significant importance until the attack on 17 December. Agent [REDACTED] noted Dr. Daldis' new technology in his capacity as [REDACTED], and dismissed it noting only “No significant security threat.”

[News Headline: New York Times, 18 Dec.]
VICE PRESIDENT ASSASSAINATED BY US SECRET SERVICE

boardgame.name: Section 6:18
boardgame.description:
User summary:

§ 6:18 is intended as a one-shot, action-oriented game that combines elements of boardgame play with roleplaying. The characters fight against an embedded team of spies as some type of unusual/interesting facility. Along the way, they may discover why the spies are targeting the facility.

boardgame.name: Serpentine: The Girl in the Maze
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Serpentine is a game about an innocent girl, travelling through a strange world in order to save a loved one. Along the way, she'll face physical challenges, tests of wit, and the trials of making friends.

User summary:

In Serpentine: The Girl in the Maze, players take turns controlling a single character.
boardgame.rpg: Serpentine: The Girl in the Maze

boardgame.name: Sex/Magic
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Rising to prominence in the late 1800's, various groups used the term "sex magick" (often with the K, sometimes without) to describe mystical practices and rituals, often involving orgasm and taboo, that could give the practitioner magical power over the world. I make no claim about those groups or their beliefs. This is a work of fiction that borrows the idea of magic-through-sexuality and feeds upon it for game play.

User summary:

The submitted game notes it is incomplete.

boardgame.name: Sexy Deadly (Game Chef)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Jody was a knife. Jody was a knife forged in the halls of ChronoLab 3-X, polished in the ranks of the Navy GUNMASKS, and tested on the populace of Tokyo. She was a knife that knew how to do its job. Jody was born without a mother. It would take forty-seven casualties before she found one...
...
Sexy Deadly is a game about women trained as infiltrators and killers. These women are nigh unparalleled in skill and meticulous dedication. They are weapons. And in and amidst that, they are women. This game asks what happens when these two things are reconciled.

boardgame.name: Stigmata: A Question of Faith
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Stigmata is a story game of personal redemption. The stories are told from the point of view of stigmatics, individuals bearing marks of intense suffering, who are charged by a divine power to redeem lost souls. Through signs, visions and even miracles the stigmatic must reveal the truth that will free the lost soul from the Cross they bear. The road to redemption is difficult and often paved with many pitfalls, not the least of which is the stigmatic's own Cross. Stigmatics will call upon their Conviction and Devotions to help them on their mission.

boardgame.name: Shovel Knight: Dungeon Duels – Shield Knight
boardgame.description: A unique hero character for Shovel Knight: Dungeon Duels that plays more defensively, able to spend coins on their turn to reflect damage back at attacking enemies!

boardgame.name: Shovel Knight: Dungeon Duels – Fish Head
boardgame.description: This Kickstarter exclusive is a uniquely fishy model of the playable Shovel Knight hero for the boardgame Shovel Knight: Dungeon Duels.

boardgame.name: Swar1• (Issue 7 - Autumn 1990)
boardgame.description:
While numbered seven, this is actually the first issue. The number 7 was a joke, allowing for fake letters commenting on (completely made up) articles in the non-existent issues 1-6, out of context "part 7" of a supposed ongoing piece of fiction...

There were also some articles discussing theoretical aspects of RPGs, a Runequest/generic fantasy module, quotes from the table...

boardgame.name: Swar1• (Issue 8 - Spring 1991)
boardgame.description: The second issue (called no. 8) contains various articles, a generic scenario inspired by the Phantom of the Opera, and humor.

boardgame.name: Swar1• (Issue 9 - Autum 1991)
boardgame.description: The third issue (called no. 9) again is filled with humor of various shapes, and a generic fantasy/Runequest module.

boardgame.name: Bee Good
boardgame.description:
Everyone knows them, the bees that fly from flower to flower in summer. They have very important duties. Through pollination, they make a significant contribution to the preservation of biodiversity. But bees are at risk. The death of bees could have far-reaching consequences for all of us. In the game you will learn about the importance of bees for our ecosystem and receive specific tips and information on how we can contribute to the preservation of bees.

Tiles are shuffled, distributed on the honeycombs on the board and turned over one by one. Each player tries to get to the beehive via a path made of green tiles and avoiding the red tiles that can hurt or kill them. Players roll a die to move around the tiles of the board to find flowers and nectar to strengthen and survive on their long journey back to the beehive in the center of the board.

Bee Good is a co-op board game. Only together can the team ensure that all bees find a way to their beehive. If a player's bee has already arrived in the beehive, he can continue playing and throw the dice for the other players and win jokers. The players win if all bees make it back to the hive.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 6 Spieldauer: 30 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 6+
BEE GOOD - Das kooperative Familienspiel rund um den Bienenerhalt!
Spielend Bienen retten: Helft den Bienen zurück zum Bienenstock zu kommen. Auf eurem Weg dorthin erfahrt ihr einiges über die Aufgaben der Insekten, aber auch über die Hintergründe für deren Bedrohung. Spielend lernen: Unterstützt die Bienen dabei, Blumen und Nektar zu finden, um zu überleben! Und erhaltet im Spielverlauf konkrete Informationen darüber, wie das Bienensterben verhindert werden kann. Spielend lernen: Im Spielverlauf erfahren die Spielenden von der Bedeutung der Biene für unser Ökosystem und erhalten konkrete Informationen und Handlungshinweise, wie sie zum Erhalt der Bienen beitragen können. Und dass ein Zusammenarbeiten dabei unerlässlich ist. Gemeinsam gilt es Hindernisse wie Monokulturen, Betonwüsten und Gifte zu überwinden, um alle Bienen zurück in den Bienenstock zu bringen. Kooperativer Spielspaß: Ein Zusammenarbeiten ist dabei unerlässlich, denn nur gemeinsam lassen sich die Hindernisse wie Monokulturen, Betonwüsten und Gifte überwinden, um alle Bienen zu retten. Spaß haben und Gutes tun: Mit jedem verkauften Spiel spendet Leona Games 1 € an die von der Stiftung für Mensch & Umwelt ins Leben gerufene Initiative "Deutschland summt! Wir tun was für Bienen".
Spielinhalt: 1 Spielplan 154 Spielplättchen davon 114 Legeplättchen, 20 Blumenjoker, 20 Glücksbienen 6 Spielfiguren 1 Würfel 1 Spielanleitung https://vimeo.com/454735248
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Zombies!!!: WTH...20 Years? Promo Card
boardgame.description:
This card says:

Power's out: Until the end of your next turn, any items in buildings may not be picked up(including weapon cards). You must fight zombies as normal.

Promo sent to backers of the 20th Anniversary edition of Zombies!!!

boardgame.name: Rossio: D.Maria II Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Rules for this promo card.

SETUP: Choose which side of the promo card to use during the game: "+1" for a more forgiving game or "-1" side for a more cutthroat game.
Place the promo card next to the game board and randomly assign a tile to it.

GAMEPLAY: During your turn, when you score the patterns on your helper cards, patterns of the same colour as the tile on the promo card will score +1 point (if using the +1 side of the promo card) or -1 point (if using the -1 side of the promo card).
Also, when building tiles on the square, players may pay 1 coin to swap any tile of their player board with the tile on the promo card.

Available as part of Pack C from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

listing.notes: Shipment: Worldwide: 0,95€
D. Maria II Promo card from 2021 Dice Tower Kickstarter. Buyer also to pay $1.10 USPS postage.

boardgame.name: Der förbaskade tornet
La torre maledetta
La tour ridicule
Der verflixte Turm
boardgame.description:
Players receive 20 tiles each in four different sizes and point values. Together they build a tower out of these until it collapses. Whoever causes the collapse receives no points, the other player, the point values from his built tiles. After several rounds, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Dungeons Of Draggmar
boardgame.description:
In this new dynamic fast paced action card game explore forgotten dungeons, keeps and fortresses. Defeat monsters, demons and bandits lurking in the forgotten tunnels through Draggmar and claim fame and riches.

The game is full of tactics and hard decisions that could result in a huge punishment if not played wisely. Dungeons Of Draggmar is a game where you will lose a lot but every victory will make you celebrate and enjoy the next step of your conquest even more!


An easy to learn experience for new players and fun for experienced ones
Replay value and a possibility of choosing the difficulty of the game
A dynamic, fast, and intense system
The game is for 1-4 players


Dungeons Of Draggmar is a fast paced action driven card game. The game takes place in rounds called Dungeon Runs where a player tries to conquer a dungeon using his Heroes and Items and claim the head of the Boss at the end of the run. Of course most of the runs end in failure but then there is always a second chance to be successful!

Earn FAME after every Dungeon Run, hire stronger Heroes, grab better Items and head again straight to the darkness of the deepest dungeon and claim victory!

You need to constantly be prepared, think in advance, sometimes trick or get help from other players and sometimes work alone to achieve your goal!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tasslehoff's Pouches of Everything
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Tasslehoff’s Pouches of Everything is your one-stop shop for all things Dragonlance and Krynn for D&D 5th Edition. During our journey through the people, organizations, monsters and magic of our favorite continent Ansalon; Uncle Tas will be your guide. Tas’ life is easily one of the most storied of anyone from Krynn. He has traveled through time and space, and done things that defy even the wildest of kender tales. That’s why we’ve recruited him to give us insight about every aspect of the world we love!

boardgame.name: Formino
boardgame.description:
With 4 of their own pieces each, the 2 opponents try to recreate the winning constellations of their card "hand" - which they have on their tray (integrated in the game board) - on the 3x3 game board, whereby only one piece may be moved per turn.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Sesamstraat Kids Bingo
boardgame.description:
The boards show pictures from Sesame Street or the five letters of the word BINGO in a 5 x 5 grid. Two dice are rolled to determine the field. The first person to cover five pictures horizontally, vertically or diagonally is the winner.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Supersedure
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A highly intelligent and evolved insect species rules the world. Larvae are born into a role, which they will fulfill until their dying day. Each colony consists of a Queen, a ruling class (divided into 13 Houses) and a vast population of specialized drones. There are drones that harvest food and water, drones that create tools and luxury items, that tend the young, and every other thing that needs to be done to keep the Hive operating. Indeed, one Hive even bred enormous drones that moved about the land, carrying House and Nest upon their backs.а The ruling class, by contrast, have evolved to be nearly human in appearance. Indeed, the more important a personage, the more human his appearance, with scholars, warriors and drones having progressively more visibly insectoid traits.

Sadly, our beloved Queen is dying. She has ruled for many long years, and the Hive has prospered. But now it is time to choose a new Queen. Thus opens the Season.

User summary:

The core mechanic of the game is a trick-taking card game; roleplaying elements are arranged around this mechanic.

boardgame.name: Tentacle Attack
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

One day, the tentacles attacked.

They seemed to be able to appear anywhere, at any time. An extradimensional horror stirred by modern scientific experiments? Humanity's collective self-loathing psychically manifesting itself? Some sort of spore only now entering a new, fast-growing phase of its eons-long life cycle? Who knows? The explanation isn't important. What's more important is your immediate goal: survival.

Tentacle Attack is an RPG in which the most of the players play characters trying to survive a modern-day tentacle apocalypse. One players is the GM, who plays almost everything else. The only exception is the tentacles. ANY player can call down a tentacle attack anywhere, at any time, on anyone, for any reason.

boardgame.name: Terrified!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In this game, players take the role of Fears – tiny, adorable monsters who personify a person’s anxieties and invisibly accompany a Hero anywhere he or she goes. This Hero is on a Mission chosen by the players, which might be anything from saving the world to getting a date. Your Fears benefit from interfering with the Hero’s Mission. The problem? If the Hero fails, you all suffer.

boardgame.name: The Games We Play
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In a world where the masses have succumb to prescription drugs and become drones, you have broke free. Now you fight back with reality shifting drugs, running the night and looking for your next big thrill- all under the guidance of a special woman. This woman, your Mother Wolf, stops you from slipping out of reality complete while you play. Can you find what you need to feel complete? Or will you just end up another statistic, another human that couldn't survive in the rigid and oppressed world of tomorrow?

boardgame.name: The Autumn War
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Province of Oak and the Province of Pine went to war at the end of the summer, but it was not until the very edge of winter when their first real battle took place in a forest at the border of their territories. Their armies, little more than militias, only a handful on either side with any experience in battle, met on a frosty morning and by nightfall, both sides were in rout, scattering through the land leaving their dead behind them for the Ugly Birds.

Now you must go among them and find the one you love, who has fallen, somewhere on the Battlefield.

User summary:

The Autumn War is intended only to support single-session games.

boardgame.name: Tatort Meer Fall 1: Die Vogelinsel
boardgame.description:
The Environmental Crime Game
Smilla is working as a birdwatcher on Bird Island. She notices many inconsistencies on the island and that fatal environmental sins are committed. Not everyone likes her curiosity. When her friend Lars came to visit, Smilla vanished without a trace. Can you figure out what happened on Bird Island based on Smilla's and Lars' documents?

- Investigate different clues and expose environmental sins
- Check alibis and motives
- Analyze sound recordings and videos
- Research online
- Contact involved people by e-mail and by phone

The line between realtiy and game blurs
By playing the game Tatort Meer | Fall 1 - Die Vogelinsel you actually are participating in the collection and utilization of plastic from the oceans. At the end of the case you choose a marine conservation organization to which we donate a part of our earnings.

Your mission
Find out who is responsible for Smilla's disappearance and find her before it's too late.

Instructions
Your goal is to break the case of the vanished birdwatcher as a team of investigators. You receive a multitude of documents with further information about different websites and other resources that are relevant to solving the case. You play either alone or together as a team and, in doing so, have to check alibis and deduce logically. Use all available accessories - even cellphones are allowed.
Internet access and writing materials are necessary!

—description from the publisher (translated)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Three Clans
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Three Clans is a roleplaying game set in a world where three barbarian tribes are spiralling towards an inevitable war. You take on the role of War Leader of ones of those clans, as well as prominent positions within the clans of your fellow players. The game forces you to examine what personal sacrifices you are willing to make on your quest to secure victory for your tribe and drives scenes and story forwards with its card based, see-sawing, conflict resolution mechanic.

The Three Clans is a strictly three player game with no game master and assumes that you are familiar enough with roleplaying to know how to narrate your character’s actions and confident enough to frame scenes and drive the game forward for the other players as well as for yourself. It also assumes that you know what a standard deck of cards is and what d10s are, and what to do with them (psst, they’re 10 sided dice…)

boardgame.name: Arkanum: Die Schatzinsel
boardgame.description:
Experience exciting puzzles - solve the puzzles to uncover the secret of Treasure Island.
Escape room game with web app for sounds and stories.
Board game for 1-6 adults from 14 years, 90-120 minutes playing time.
Unique 3D game board - scissors, pen, internet access and light source (cell phone or flashlight) required to play.
No destruction of material necessary! However, once you have solved the game, you know the solution.

boardgame.name: The Code Agency Sonderermittlung Krimispiel Fall 1: Flammen im Theater
boardgame.description:
For the whole family - interactive and cooperative Murder Mystery board game for adults and children from 13 years.
Solve the riddle - Follow the exciting story of the burned out Figaro Theater in this riddle game.
Realistic Material - Work your way through 25+ realistic documents and examine real finds from the burned theater.
Fun for everyone - the criminal case can be solved alone, in pairs or in a team with up to 6 players.
Gift idea - The crime game is also ideal as a gift for Escape Room fans and friends of exciting board games.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: The Code Agency Sonderermittlung Krimispiel Fall 2: Das Verschwinden des Gary Sander
The Code Agency Sonderermittlung Krimispiel Fall 2: Das Verschwinden des Gary Sander

boardgame.name: Exit-Game Wochenkalender 2022: Der Schnitter
boardgame.description:
53 new puzzles - 53 possible victims of the reaper!

A must for all fans of escape games and challenging puzzles
There is a new task waiting for you every week
Puzzles alone, with friends or family
Dysturbia's last line-up is in mortal danger: a former killer of the Syndicate crime organization, who calls himself "The Reaper", is running amok. He wants to eliminate all enemies of the cartel on his own within a year. Police, public prosecutor's office, journalism - anyone who still stands up for law and truth in Dysturbia will be targeted by the assassin!

Your detective agency Dyscover is also on the hit list. After all, the reaper grants his targets a week's hangover: every Monday he hides a riddle somewhere in town. If you find it and solve it by Sunday evening, he will spare his next victim. Otherwise it has to die. Take your chance!

boardgame.name: Tiki Wars
boardgame.description:
Gonzo Polynesian Science-Fantasy

From the introduction:

Welcome to Tiki Island! Once upon a time, it was home to researchers who worked in a base on projects so super-secret that the only possible location suitable was an island in the middle of the Pacific Ocean, uninhabited but for the strange carved Tiki Heads that some mysterious peoples left behind. The researchers worked on their projects, developing strange and wonderful technologies.

boardgame.name: Timebound
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The history of humanity is long, containing legions of tyrants, conquerors, reformers, paragons...and ordinary people who just want to get by. In the Age of Chains, a time beyond time, souls are thrust together in chaotic conflicts.

Perhaps it is a result of magic or science gone wrong. Perhaps ancient gods play tricks on humanity. Perhaps an unenlightened species has earned an afterlife of eternal war. Perhaps these are merely visions of chosen souls.

Perhaps it doesn't matter why. What truly matters is how you react...

boardgame.name: Pocket-Escape: Schlagabtausch
boardgame.description:
Carl Mac Sweeney's former boxing coach Eddie is in trouble:
He owes the syndicate money. A lot of money. In desperation, he turns to Carl and asks him a favor - because Eddie knows where to get something...

28 pages full of puzzles, action and difficult decisions are waiting for you. Pocket Escape: The exchange of blows fits in every pocket - the ideal case for at home or in your luggage!

boardgame.name: Tears of Destiny
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It's cold. Your back aches from the unforgiving metal that encompasses your fatigued body. There's a hum coming from somewhere else. Its constant vibration is a comfort. Something that can be relied upon. There is almost no light save the dim twinkles coming from the control panels that guard the airlocks and entryways. It's cold.

boardgame.name: Pocket-Escape: Schatten der Vergangenheit
boardgame.description:
Alice discovers her likeness on a wanted poster - an aunt is looking for her! Does this aunt really exist? Or is the profile just a trap? Alice has to use all her courage and ingenuity to face her past...

28 pages full of puzzles, action and difficult decisions.

boardgame.name: Toybox of Terror
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

T'was the night before Christmas and .... oh if only things were that happy. The Toys remember Christmas and the happy time when they were give to The Kid. That was a long long time ago. Over each Christmas and each birthday, new Toys came into the playroom. Some lasted the distance, others didn't have what it takes. Belonging to The Kid could be a dangerous life, but every Toy put their 'Made in China' mark on the line because it was The Kid's love that kept them going.

boardgame.name: Winter Noir
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:


Frosty the snowman was a jolly happy soul,



With a corncob pipe and a button nose,



And two eyes made out of coal.


...

Frosty is a glory hound and a motherfucking liar. He wasn’t the first and was by no means the last snowman to come to life. Just the only one to be so fucking obvious about it that the humans still sing that obnoxious song. And that shabby damn hat isn’t magical. Of course, he’d tell you that it’s the style of the tale rather than the truth of it that counts, but if you’re willing to go along with that then I pray you never cross paths with the icemen.

boardgame.name: Witch Hunt
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Witch Hunt is a roleplaying game...about witches who protect people, about which they receive prophetic visions, from Death.

The Witches, have decided to defy death by saving people with great destinies/potential; they must decide which of the numerous marks, of which they receive visions, is most deserving of being saved. The witches will only able to save one mark.

boardgame.name: Your Father's Armor
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You've seen Mulan, right? This is a storytelling game where you're going to tell some tales that revolve around the same theme: you're dressing as a man because there's something that needs doing, that needs a man, and none of the men in your family can do it. You can play this game with several of your friends.

boardgame.name: Zeebo Streetball 2
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The early 90’s were a transformative time for video games. It was then that they were first recognized as a carrier of art, culture, and heavy finance. It was an unpopular viewpoint with few respected proponents, but the foundations placed during these years were instrumental in the decade to come.

Many games were released during this period that the videogames-as-art movement would later use to bolster their arguments within galleries and institutes of higher learning. Most of these replicated literary and filmic techniques with the added benefit of player response mechanisms that raw text and the flat screen could only dream of.

The greatest of these, in my opinion, is Zeebo Streetball 2. My main reason for writing this FAQ despite the stack of newer games crying for my attention is to convince the masses of this overlooked gem's worth. It has been passed by time and again by the crowning arts academies for its "relentless bugs", "muddled execution", and "not being about anything." I argue that these are its greatest strengths. Only in this chaos can anything approaching true personality escape. Where else are we going to see such breadth and depth of quasi-human thought? Not Tetris, that's for sure.

boardgame.name: The Aquabats!: Super Showdown!
boardgame.description:
In The Aquabats! Super Showdown! card game, two to four players are villains competing to capture all five members of The Aquabats, the world's greatest superhero rock band.

The game consists of three types of cards: Monster cards, Action cards, and Aquabats cards. Monster cards have colors and power levels. Each turn, a player plays a Monster card and draws a new Monster card. If the card played is of the same color and a higher power level than the card previously played, that player may draw both a Monster card and an Action card. At the start of a player's turn, a Battle card or Epic Battle card may be played, challenging one player or all players respectively to a showdown. Each player in the battle must play a Monster card, and the winner may take an Aquabat card from the table or, if none remain, steal one from the defeated player.

Shrink Ray cards enable a challenged player to diminish the power of an aggressor; X-Ray cards allow one to peak at another player's hand; Antibats cards foil the winner of a battle from taking a loser's Aquabat card; and Steal cards can be used to acquire another player's Aquabat card without a battle.

Play continues until one player acquires all five Aquabat cards or until War is mutually declared, in which case the winner of a single round Epic Battle is declared the game's victor.

boardgame.name: Companion Quest
boardgame.description:
This game presents 5 clues to the identity of a Companion.

With over 500 jewels covering the lives of over 100 Companions, encapsulated in a thrilling clues game, Companion Quest is one of a kind. As a dual game, designed to be played between two people or teams, clues are read out revealing the identity of a Companion.

The faster you guess, the more points you gain.
The set also contains a bonus Highlights and Villains set which completes the package beautifully.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Companion Clues
boardgame.description:
This game poses a question and gives kids four possible answers to choose from.

This children's game uses logical deduction and multiple choice questions to learn about the Companions.

It's a fantastic learning tool to get to know about the Sahaba in a thought-provoking way.

Companion Clues covers 60 Sahaba and is also designed to be played as a duel game between two or more people or teams.

Score more points by answering the harder questions.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Hound of Yth and Cath
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Soaked in sanguine reds and nails painted a blackened green, the Hound of Yth and Cath invades east from the west for more to gore in the vain attempt to meagerly shallow its depthless stomach. Brave the canine barbarian's omnicidal feast for flesh and grant it the death it demands - For every second the hound lives without another corpse in its mouth the more drastic its mean to do so grow.

boardgame.name: The King Under the Mountain
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A one way descent into facing the divine destruction that sleeps deep in the planet - Tackle the hermitic herald of the apocalypse that hides away in the world's dirt until his time comes to ravage what remains of its wastelands and people. Cowardice at the precipice of destiny will be met by the wrath of the fates.

boardgame.name: Mysteries on Arcturus Station
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Deep in the Arcturus Belt, Station Three serves as a hub for business, commerce, and much needed rest for hard-working asteroid miners. But beneath the veneer and flashing casino lights, it is a place of theft, treachery, and murder. Mysteries on Arcturus Station contains two separate investigative adventures which can be played individually or as a series, with one crime leading into the next.

In The Hunt For Sabre IV the Travellers are hired by a mining company to locate a missing ore carrier. What they uncover is conspiracy and murder. The Travellers must hurry to find the ship before the criminals can escape.

Murder on Arcturus Station is a reimagining of the Classic Traveller adventure. A corporate executive has been murdered, and Travellers are the prime suspects unless they can catch the killer in time. It is up to the referee to decide which of the ten suspects is guilty and how they did it. Was it the estranged wife? His mistress? The Solomani rebel? The Aslan noble? This adventure provides all the tools to construct each of the possible crimes, complete with motives, clues, alibis, and misleading information pointing to the wrong suspect.

boardgame.name: The Lighthouse of Graybill
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Temperatures are rising in Termalaine and winter is no more! But the sudden heat could mean trouble for the town. Can you figure out whats going on before its too late?

A 4 hour adventure for Tier 1 Characters

This adventure starts off in Termalaine, one of the Ten-Towns in Icewind dale and is based on the The Warmest Day hook from the Dungeoncraft program. It involves the characters discovering that a wizard's invention has gone out of control. They will travel up a tower to try facing constructs and puzzles to try and stop the invention before it destroys the town.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Beggar's Blood
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When warped creatures emerge from the Lonelywood Forest, you're tasked to contain them. But how will you confront what uncountable others refuse to?

A 4 hour adventure for 1st through 4th level Characters.

Map of the Final Area - A tree on a cliff over a lake of strange blood

This adventure takes place in Icewind Dale, in the Lonelywood Forest.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Among the Conifers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A fledgling adventuring company returns bloody and beaten to Lonelywood and their implacable foe follows, bringing impending doom upon the town.

A Two- to Four-Hour Dungeoncraft Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

This adventure is set in Icewind Dale during the Plague of Ancients (Season 10).
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Final Tribute
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Prince Oargev of New Cyre knows the location of the secret Cyran creation forge, but a grim litany of recent disasters has shaken his throne: plague, treachery, recession, and insurgency. This intelligence could buy him a chance to rebuild anew, but who’ll be his highest bidder? Optimized for APL 17, this is the first in a quartet of adventures, the Flames of War storyline.

boardgame.name: Alliance of the Sacred Suns
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Alliance of the Sacred Suns (AotSS) is a game unlike many that you have ever played. It is foremost a grand strategy game, with 4X elements, but also character and House management. We call it a 5X – the 5th ‘X’ being ‘eXist’. You are a character in AotSS, and if you die, the game ends… so tread lightly, your Majesty!MAIN GAME FEATURES:


Top – level management – you have Action Points that are finite and vary from turn to turn. You can do almost anything, but you can’t do everything



You are the Emperor – you are a character in a game that has hundreds that you will interact with. If you die, or are deposed, the game is over



Multiple layers of strategy – from a traditional 4X-type (exploring and scanning new systems, colonizing planets, establishing outposts, building militaries and trade) upwards to developing your Great House and managing the other Houses that all have specialties that you can only take advantage of if you are on friendly terms with them, to discovering and reaching out to other breakaway human civilizations, to your ultimate goal of uniting the Celestial Empire against a final attack by humanities’ oldest enemy, the Xyl



Dynamic character relationship model – you can affect your relationships with Actions that you can take against characters, from giving a speech to challenging them to having them executed. Of course, they have relationships with others in the game too, so consider the knock-on effects of anything you do…



Great and Minor Houses – Houses limit what you can do as Emperor. Houses own territory, armies, etc. and if you piss them off, they may even try to usurp the Empire. Build alliances to allow characters with special talents and traditions to develop the Empire the way you want. For example, if you want a strong economy, you need good miners to ensure your factories run at full capacity, so you’ll want House Ilioaia (who has a strong mining tradition) on your side so you can appoint their members as viceroys of high-mineral planets… and so on.



Don’t micromanage, create a Project! Unlike traditional 4X games, you don’t make build queues, you create Projects to get things done, from colonizing a planet to throwing a celebration to upgrading a logistical region. You must assign an Adminstrator who gains power and influence from this post, and determines how smoothly your project will go! Assigning characters to Projects is a great way for them to earn power and influence… but take care that they do not gain too much, especially if they are of a House that hates you…


WHAT’S AOTSS ALL ABOUT?

AotSS is a grand strategy game that takes place in the year 3050. Over 1,000 years ago, an alien race known as the Xyl came to Earth through a stargate that humanity had unwittingly built from wreckage that had been found 40 years prior. The Xyl used the stargate to attack Earth, and in the process nearly destroyed humanity. Earth was decimated, and only a small group of colonists escaped through the hastily reprogrammed stargate, to a part of the galaxy tens of thousands of light-years away. As the last remnants of humanity, they colonized a terran-like planet, New Terra, and seeked to rebuild civilization. For almost 500 years, humanity was allowed to grow and flourish, and the Terran Alliance was born, in an attempt to protect humanity from another such attack. Slowly, new races and sub-races evolved as humanity spread further and further from the warm core of Neo-Sirius and New Terra. But all were part of the Alliance, and peace and prosperity were the order of the day. Weapon research gave way to terraforming, economic enlightenment, and prosperity for any and all of the Alliance.

Until the Xyl, who had hunted the last humans for half an eon, finally found them and struck again.

Not equipped to wage full-scale war like their ancestors, the Terran Alliance was mauled, across planets to stars to provinces. One by one, whole provinces went dark, consumed by the Xyl. Finally, with the Xyl prepared to attack and defeat New Terra herself, a virus was developed that stopped the Xyl and ensured humanity’s survival – for the moment.

Enraged at the Terran Alliance’s inability to protect huge swaths of humanity, many of the far rim colonies and systems decided to break away and form their own civilizations, with their own cultures. At home, to prevent anarchy, the Great Houses rose to protect what was left of the Alliance and, to mollify an increasingly restless population, reformed the Alliance as the Celestial Empire, with the first Emperor, Magnus I, ordained to begin the reformation of humanity.

It is now almost 500 years since the Second Xyl war. With increasingly weak emperors and empresses, rising Houses who would claim their own part of the Empire, a stagnant scientific community that has lost technology from a thousand years ago, you are born. You are different from all other heirs… you have unexplained psychic abilities that allow you limited control over men and their motivations, but you also know one other thing:

The Xyl are coming, and unless you can rebuild the shattered Empire, develop technology to wage war, and lead your greatest people towards this goal, they will finish the extinction of humanity.

Welcome to your Empire, Your Majesty.

WOULD I LIKE IT?

If you like deep, grand-strategy 4X games, you probably would. HOWEVER, since you’re only one Emperor, even a divine one, you can only do so much every turn. So if you like to micromanage and min-max every little thing, you may not like AotSS as much. The game focuses on managing from a true top-down perspective, as a real Emperor might, as opposed to you personally requesting that planet X should build 4 mines in a specific region. That’s your viceroy’s job – let them do it! In summary, if you like some or most of the following games, you might like AotSS:

boardgame.name: Terra Invicta
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Terra Invicta is a grand strategy alien invasion game from the creators of the Long War mods for XCOM and XCOM 2.An alien force has arrived in the far reaches of Solar System and begun probing Earth's defenses and building an invasion fleet. The player must assemble a council of scientists, politicians, military leaders and operatives who can unite Earth's squabbling nations with the ultimate goal of taking the fight to the aliens in the high ground of outer space.

FEATURES

Recruit and develop a council of leaders and operatives who can influence world events and bring Earth’s squabbling nations into the fold
Experience a living model of Earth’s modern-day geopolitics and the impact of the arrival of a hostile alien intelligence
Industrialize space by constructing space stations, asteroid mining outposts and colonies, and develop technologies taken from NASA’s drawing boards and military research laboratories
Explore a detailed and accurate model of Earth’s Solar System, which will serve as a dynamic strategic map in which the game’s factions must compete for resources
Build a space fleet able to defend Earth and its colonies from alien infiltration craft and battleships
Command interplanetary warships against both hostile humans and the aliens within an environment that obeys Newton’s laws

boardgame.name: The Big Book of Characters Volume 20
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Oftentimes we find ourselves sitting around the table, with a set adventure path before our players, and the inevitable happens. One player is unprepared for the session or is in need of a new character.

No problem.

Within this collection are 100 different characters. Each Character has an origin, a reason for leaving, family members and their disposition towards the character. Non-human Characters also have a middle name in common for non native speakers. Each character comes with character points to spend on abilities and the players can decide which profession they want to follow in the Morgalad Core RPG Book, and they have money to buy equipment.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: El gran libro de los personajes

boardgame.name: Fast Drive Football
boardgame.description:
Fast Drive Football (FDF) is a free, one-player, card & dice tabletop game that simulates (American) Pro Football. It's a "drive-by-drive" game, meaning that instead of simulating each individual play, you are simulating one possession at a time. Games take about 15-20 minutes to play once you learn the rules.

"On any given Sunday..." FDF is unique in that most results are driven by team qualities - not precise numerical statistics. This approach allows for the development of a more colorful narrative throughout the game. The game book was designed to ensure that teams perform as they did in real life, but also to allow for the occasional surprise that keeps you coming back to roll just one more game...

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: UNO Triple Play
UNO Triple Play Stealth
boardgame.description:
UNO Triple Play features the familiar UNO gameplay, with players trying to rid themselves of cards first, but this game comes with a special electronic unit that holds three discard piles and features lights and sounds. On your turn, you can play onto a discard pile only if it's lit up — and if any pile gets too many cards in it, it may overload, with the LED display indicating how many cards must be drawn!

Lights and arcade sounds on the machine create maximum anticipation and excitement, and the "timer mode" makes the game move even faster. As always, when players have only one card left, they must yell "UNO!"

boardgame.name: Crossing Fates
boardgame.description:
In Crossing Fates 7 different nations fight for supremacy. But temporary alliances give players special powers with which they can score more points, or steal from their opponents.
Cleverly play and match cards for Fate Points and combine totems for various effects. A deceptively simple game with lots of strategy. Will you win the Battle of Fates?

Crossing Fates is a competitive card game for 2 to 4 players.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Corvette Command
boardgame.description:
Corvette Command is a strategic level solo narrative generating game giving you the chance to experience the worst that the Atlantic can throw at you while taking on the German U-boats. Your crew starts out raw and with basic skills which they get the opportunity to improve over the course of the campaign. Your mission is to protect the convoy from attack and success is measured by the scale of the losses incurred rather than by how many U-boats are sunk. If vital supplies are lost then this can impact on how quickly new technology becomes available to you such as radar and HF/DF detection.

It is May 1941 and the Battle of the Atlantic is reaching a critical point. The Royal Canadian Navy has extended its convoy cover eastwards and the Royal Navy has pushed their cover west so that convoys are now escorted the whole way across the Atlantic. For the purposes of game play only these two forces have been combined and you command a single Flower Class Corvette all the way across the Atlantic. Although the “Escort Gap” has been closed the “Air Gap” remains. The escorts are still waiting for the arrival of ship borne radar and spotting surfaced U-Boats and keeping station on convoys in the dark and poor visibility is still reliant on the lookouts. Ship to ship communications is also via signal lamps and flags and occasionally by loud hailer. The game ends on 31st May 1943.

This is a free print and play game that can be played in a small footprint with optional advanced rules that enable you to play a quick set up one-off game or a two player game and introduce greater level of detail. If you enjoyed Nicholas Monsarrat’s book or film “The Cruel Sea” then don your sea going gear and head out into the Atlantic.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Detective Rummy
boardgame.description:
Detective Rummy is a rummy-style card game with a storytelling element revealed in a series of seven different cases. Players take the roles of detectives vying to solve the cases and gain fame.

The story begins at the legendary Rummy Detective Agency, and each case takes you to various locations to solve a crime, including the diner with the best doughnuts in town, the cozy "Quarter to 3 Bar", a ritzy fashion emporium, the circus, the most elite jazz nightclub in town, and more.

The cases in Detective Rummy can be played in two different ways: Campaign Mode and Case Mode. In Campaign Mode, you play all seven cases in order. In Case Mode, you can play cases 2 to 6 as standalone Detective Rummy games one at a time. Since new "Game Changer" cards are discovered in each case in different orders (if at all) each time you play, cases will never resolve the same way twice. You can play both the campaign mode or the individual cases as many times as you like.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a world wrapped in deep forests, where humanity lives in the shadows of the great trees.

Here, there are special plants whose roots reach deep down to the Fount of Magic. Drinking from this mysterious pool fills them with wondrous powers. Such plants are known to the dwellers of this world as Herbs, and each and every one possesses mystical powers; some that bless the lives of humanity, and some that wound and curse.

boardgame.name: The King in the North
El Rey en el Norte
boardgame.description:
With similar mechanisms from the famous Sekigahara and later Granada, last stand of the Moors.

The King in the North is a game for 2 players that represents the first Civil War called the Carlist War that took place between 1833 and 1839, among the Carlists, supporters of the Infant Carlos María Isidro de Borbón and an absolutist regime, and the so called Liberals, Cristinos or Isabelinos, defenders of Isabel II and the regent María Cristina de Borbón, whose government was in the modest absolutist origins and eventually became liberal to obtain greater popular support.
Although the war spanned most of Spain, mainly in the Basque Country, Navarra, Catalonia, Aragon and Valencia, in this game only the fighting in the North is represented.

—description from the designer

It is surprising that Spain's First Carlist War remains Europe's most neglected nineteenth-century civil war in the English scholarship. This lacuna is unworthy of the conflict's importance. It was both the last great European conflict of the pre-industrial age and an iconic moment in the pan-European struggle between liberalism and absolutism.
From the book "With the British Legion: A Story of the Carlist Wars" by G.A. Henty

Con mecánicas similares al aclamado Sekigahara y Granada.
El Rey en el Norte es un juego para 2 jugadores que representa la primera Guerra Civil llamada Guerra Carlista que tuvo lugar entre 1833 y 1839, entre los Carlistas, partidarios del Infante Carlos María Isidro de Borbón y de un régimen absolutista, y los Isabelinos, defensores de Isabel II y de la regente María Cristina de Borbón, cuyo gobierno fue en los orígenes absolutista moderado y acabó convirtiéndose en liberal para obtener mayor apoyo popular. Aunque la guerra se desarrolló en varias regiones de España, País Vasco, Navarra, Cataluña, Aragón y Valencia, en este juego sólo se representa la que tuvo lugar en el Norte.
Un jugador llevará el bando Isabelino formado por cinco facciones: Guardia Real, Ejercito Regular, Milicias, Chapelgorris y Legión Extranjera.
Y el otro jugador llevará el bando Carlista formado a su vez por cinco facciones: Álava, Castilla, Guipuzcoa, Navarra y Vizcaya.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
