boardgame.name: Vacu
boardgame.description:
Vacu is a Go-like territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.



Definitions

In these rules, "adjacent" always means "orthogonally adjacent".

A group is a stone along with all other like-colored stones one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent stones of its color.

Similarly, a territory is an empty point along with all other empty points one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent empty cells. You own a territory if all stones adjacent to points in that territory are of your color.

A liberty of a group is an empty point adjacent to at least one stone in that group.

To flip a group is to replace all its stones with stones of the opposite color.

To suppress a group is to remove all its stones from the board.

Your score is the number of stones of your color on the board, plus the number of points in your territories, plus komi (see below) if you play White.



Play

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, pass or place a stone of your color on an empty point. If this stone is part of a group with liberties, suppress all enemy groups without liberties. Otherwise, suppress your group without liberties and flip all enemy groups that had no liberties before the suppression. In the latter case, at least one group must be flipped for the move to be legal.

The game ends when either both players pass in succession or a player flips or suppresses the last enemy group on the board. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. The button is used to avoid ties.

If, after a board play, the same board position appears for the third time with the same player to move, the game ends in a draw. A pass is not a board play.



Komi and button

Komi is the whole number of points which is added to White's score at the end of the game as a compensation for playing second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. Alternatively, experienced players may agree on a standard value for all games.

The button is a special token which is placed next to the board at the start of the game. On your turn, if neither player has taken the button yet, you may not pass, but you may take the button instead of making a board play. At the end of the game, a half point is added to the score of the player who has taken the button. When checking for repetitions, two identical board positions are still considered different if the button had already been taken in one of them but not in the other.



Variants

Convacu: The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white. If you have no other moves available, you must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed. If, at the end of a turn, there is a group touching the two opposite board edges of its color, the owner of that group wins.

You’ll need a copy of 1817 to play this game.

boardgame.name: 18Milwaukee
boardgame.description: Published exclusively in the Autumn 2021 edition of TraXX Mainline magazine, 18 Milwaukee is an 18xx game set along the routes of the historic Milwaukee Road Hiawatha trains. Featuring the proven 1846 game system, this variant features beer delivery to enhance your routes, and the ability to create new cities where none previously existed - no early route is safe! You’ll need a copy of 1846 to play this game.

boardgame.name: The Hiawathas
boardgame.description: Published exclusively in the Autumn 2021 edition of TraXX Mainline magazine, The Hiawathas is an 18xx game set along the routes of the historic Milwaukee Road Hiawatha trains. Featuring the proven 1830 game system, this variant allows you to draw track instead of placing track tiles. You’ll need a copy of 1830 to play this game.

boardgame.name: Irish Gauge: Hiawatha Gauge
boardgame.description: Published exclusively in the Autumn 2021 edition of TraXX Mainline magazine, Hiawatha Gauge is a cube rails game set along the routes of the historic Milwaukee Road Hiawatha trains. Featuring the proven Irish Gauge game system, this is a "magazine game" variant on a small map with only three companies. You’ll need a copy of Irish Gauge to play this game.

boardgame.name: Миссионерские путешествия апостола Павла
boardgame.description:
In Миссионерские путешествия апостола Павла, ("Missionary travels of the Apostle Paul"), the players will embark on a fascinating adventure in the footsteps of the missionary journey of the apostle.

It will begin in Jerusalem, from where Saul went to Damascus to begin massacring the Christians of this city. And it will continue in the cities of Asia Minor and Europe.
Many adventures await them: ferocious lions, robbers and even a shipwreck.
The winner is the player who overcomes all obstacles and gets to Rome first.

During the game, they will be able to get acquainted with the letters of the Apostle Paul, addressed to different churches, which he founded during his missionary travels.

So, imagine that you are the apostle Paul, and off you go! You will face many difficulties, but fulfill your mission - to bring the good news of Jesus Christ to the peoples of the Balkan Peninsula and Asia Minor.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Get Past & GO!
boardgame.description:
Get Past & GO! is a competitive, family-friendly card game for 2-4 players. Race against your opponents to be the first player to reach the end of their path and overcome the mysterious 'Final Hazard'.

Through turn-based play, dash along your path of cards as quickly as possible - turning over each step as you go. Use Tool cards (like a torch or a tin of sardines) to get past a series of Hazards set by your opponents, or place Hazards on their paths to slow them down! Give yourself an advantage or frustrate other players with Action Cards or once-per-game Bonus Cards!

Get Past & GO! is a standalone game with 90 illustrated cards and rule variations for 2-player showdowns.

On you marks, get set, GO!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Blades of the Jhereg
boardgame.description:
INTRODUCTION
Like Blades in the Dark, the game upon which it's based,
Blades of the Jhereg is a game in which you play daring scoundrels who try to advance the goals of a criminal
organization. Play Blades of the Jhereg if you:


Enjoy Steven Brusts’ Taltos series (not a requirement, but highly recommended).
Want to play a Forged in the Dark system in which:


- Magic is commonplace. All characters have access to teleportation, psionic communication, and revivification.
- You operate in a complex feudal society in which elven nobles rule over commoners and humans.
- You can play a crime boss, a sorcerer, a witch, or a witch’s familiar

(From the introduction)

boardgame.name: Song of Farca
boardgame.description:
You are Isabella Song – a hacker PI

Your job is to hack cameras, phones, and computers, as well as question suspects, analyze evidence and draw conclusions. But don't forget that in Farca city, even criminals can end up victims.

Corporations and criminal gangs have carved Farca city up into zones of influence, and there's nothing the corrupt government can do about it.

The police and the state do nothing, leaving residents no choice but to turn to private investigators. A hacker PI Isabella Song may be under house arrest, but that won't stop her from uncovering crimes that the police have turned a blind eye to due to pressure from the mafia.

Key features:


Launch drones and gain access to personal messages and deeply hidden secrets
Recover corrupted video files and photos
Draw conclusions by questioning suspects and analyzing biometric data
Combine leads to create a database of hard evidence
Analyze evidence using AI
Rely solely on the facts – sometimes, clients can lie, and suspects can end up victims
Make life-changing decisions and live with the consequences


Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: UFO2: Extraterrestrials
boardgame.description:
Fight the alien hordes.

User Summary

boardgame.name: Gather Round! Alice in the Wonder Museum
boardgame.description:
"Gather the characters from Alice's story and start your own little funny tale!"

In Gather Round! Alice in the Wonder Museum, each player has a hand of cards featuring small and large portraits of seven characters from the books by Lewis Carrol. The game has a whimsical graphic design, utilizing the original illustrations by John Tenniel.

The goal is to have a hand of five cards where every small portrait matches a large portrait. Upon building a complete hand, the player scores a point for each small portrait in their hand. The first player to 20 points wins.

Each player keeps four cards in their hand. On your turn, you draw from the deck or the discards of other players. Trying to build a set of matching cards in hand is a puzzle, with each card having one large portrait and one to three small portraits. If your turn ends without creating a completed hand, discard one card face up in front of you. Be careful, because other players will be able to choose from your discards, but you cannot.

listing.notes:
Shrink
$6 shipping CONUS

boardgame.name: Charges: Antiques et médiévales
boardgame.description:
Miniature wargame rules to simulate battles from Antiquity to the Middle Ages.

Using figures 15 to 28 mm.

It offers a budget system to build balanced battles that allows for competition games.

boardgame.name: Farting Frenchies: Pugs Fart, Too!
boardgame.description: Expansion pack featuring Pugs. This stink-packed expansion pack includes 54 playing cards that can be used to expand your Farting Frenchies game to add 2-3- more players. It can also be played as a complete stand alone game for 2-3 players.

boardgame.name: Farting Frenchies: Celebrity Dogs Fart, Too!
boardgame.description: This stink-packed expansion pack includes 54 playing cards that can be used to expand your Farting Frenchies game to add 2-3 more players. It can also be played as a complete stand alone game for 2-3 players.

boardgame.name: Dragões: Guardiões da Memória
boardgame.description:
Dragões: Guardiões da Memória is a memory game designed for three children from 6+.

One of the children will be the the guardian, rolling the 4 custom dice showing the 4 parts of a dragon (head, torso, legs and tail) behind a shield. After that, the guardian raise the shield allowing the other two to see the dice results (the color of each dragon part) for a time between 5 and 15s (depending on the age of the players).

When the shield is placed again in position, hiding the dice, the players (not the guardian) must create the result of the dice using tiles representing the dragon parts in the correct colors.
If one child correctly assemble the dragon, he or she receive one dragon egg. The first player to obtain 3 dragon eggs become the new guardian and the game starts again.

There are variants for older children also, including one where the players must start the assemble according to a coin result, from head or from tail. There is also variants for 1 and 2 players.

boardgame.name: For the Homeworld
boardgame.description:
For the Homeworld is designed around the simple concepts of “Full Thrust” and “Babylon 5: A Call to Arms” that got people back into playing Starship Combat games. We also need enough depth to make the games play out like your favorite Science Fiction Shows. We had a lot of success from 2004-2010 between the Babylon 5, Noble Armada and Starfleet license that Mongoose Publishing had. So like me, you might have a closet full of Starship Miniatures that you would like to interact with each other.

Included in the game are rules and weapons to make it "multi-verse" for your own IP, but also includes ready to go Generic Ships and Lists if you want to play in our Universe. In addition to the Data Cards you can photo copy out of the rulebook, we also have Generic Starship Cards you can download here and on our website. Sized to conveniently be the size of a playing card so you can slip them into a conventional card sleeve with a backing card.

Some of the basics are a basic distance movement value, to keep it simple. But to add some tactical flare, there are both Arcs of fire on weapons - as well as - Arcs where the Hull value on a ship differs (the sides or the rear usually).

As a gamer I have really enjoyed the break from reality that Starship Combat games offer. Working on the "Wolf 359 Combat Simulator" for Last Unicorn Games in the early 2000's, and later with Mongoose in their playtesting and development of the (3) "A Call to Arms" games. It is my hope that through modern production technology, I can bring these rules to life and you can join me in enjoying this sort of Non Electronic Tabletop Wargame.

This will be our 3rd self-published release, and I hope you will join us in playing it.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Frigid Zombies
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Horror Story - Can you save the village in time?

Introduction: The tiny village of Icefeathers does not appear on any map. Even in the Ten Towns it is difficult to find somebody who could give directions to the frozen outpost. Like most in the north, the citizens who live there are a rugged folk, used to the bitter cold and challenges. Now, a new undead danger threatens their precarious existence. Unless the player characters intervene, the village will be overrun and only the frigid zombies will prevail.

A 2-4-hour adventure for 2nd-4th level characters.

boardgame.name: The Blasted Heath
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A mysterious object crashed into a small farm many years ago. The surrounding area has had the life pulled from it and has become barren.

The party stumbles across the clearing, and by exploring, becomes changed. They are recruited to use their new senses to recover an ancient tablet that’s protected by malevolent forces from beyond.

The temple is hundreds of years old, what could still be down there to discover, and why can they bypass the barrier when all before them have failed?

A "Ribus the Wizard" 5-hour D&D 5e adventure for levels 4 to 6.

This adventure can be dropped in and used as an extra side plot or one shot in any setting. The first encounter can occur during any overland travel and the remaining encounters can happen anytime thereafter.

boardgame.name: Rise of the Genie Lords Part 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Lands of Intrigue Await

A thousand miles south of Waterdeep lies the country of Calimshan. It is a harsh land that has been heavily scarred by magic and warfare.

It is in these lands that the genies established their empires. Though these empires have since fallen to humans, the time has come for the genies to try and take back what was once theirs.

This is the first in a series of adventures that will take you on a quest to prevent the genie lords of old from returning and reclaiming the country of Calimshan.

boardgame.name: Rise of the Genie Lords Part 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A pair of tomes are all that's needed to bring the genie lords Calim and Memnon back from their prisons in the Elemental Planes. It's up to you to destroy them so they don't fall into the wrong hands.

Your journey will take you to the City of Memnon, on the northern borders of Calimshan, through the ruins of Memnonnar, to the City of Brass on the Elemental Plane of Fire and finally to the Great Conflagration, the only place where the tomes can be destroyed.

This is the second in a series of adventurers that will take you on a quest to prevent the genie lords of old from returning and reclaiming the country of Calimshan. Are you ready for the second part of your adventure?

boardgame.name: Rise of the Genie Lords Part 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For nearly a thousand years, the earth genies have been enslaved to the Forgotten God and his people. Now they have an opportunity to remove that curse and take control of the lands of Calimshan.

To stop them, you will need to venture beneath the streets of Calimshan in order to reach the town of Kzelter, a small town long controlled by the Church of Bane.

This is the third in a series of adventures that will take you on a quest to prevent the genie lords of old from returning and reclaiming the country of Calimshan. Are you ready for the second part of your adventure?

boardgame.name: Rise of the Genie Lords Part 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deep beneath the waves of the Shining Sea lies the ancient city of Ajhuutal. It is here that the ancient water genie lord, Ajhuu, remains bound by Calim’s magic.

In this adventure, you will need to venture into the depths of the Shining Sea to prevent Ozhan and his followers from freeing the ancient water genie lord by collecting the talismans Calim used to bind him.

This is the fourth in a series of adventures that will take you on a quest to prevent the genie lords of old from returning and reclaiming the country of Calimshan. Are you ready for the fourth part of your adventure?

boardgame.name: Rise of the Genie Lords Part 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The armies of Calimport and Memnon gather in the Calim Desert for a final attempt to raise one of the genie lords of old.

In this adventure, you will journey to the Wealdath in the lands of Tethyr to recruit the aid of an ancient elf, the only one capable of reforging the Calimemnon Crystal.

This is the fifth and final adventure in a series that takes you on a quest to prevent the genie lords of old from returning and reclaiming the country of Calimshan. Are you ready for the final chapter?

boardgame.name: Xen'drik Expedition to Tomb of Annihilation
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Xen'drik Expedition to Tomb of Annihilation provides Game Masters with a series of encounters they can run as part of the expedition portion of the Tomb of Annihilation adventure in the Eberron Campaign Setting.

boardgame.name: The Silver Flame of Eston
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Pyre, the flame of Eston, was once known as Cyre's greatest church dedicated to the Silver Flame. Standing like a fortress over a dark entrance into the underground realm of Khyber, the church protected some of the most vile artifacts ever to be recovered from the minions of the daelkyr. Unfortunately, like everything else in Cyre, the church was destroyed on the Day of Mourning, and while the divine wards of the church's vaults remain intact, they are left undefended from the machinations of the daelkyr. Now, the Church of the Silver Flame has called upon the Diggers' Union to assist them in the recovery of the dangerous artifacts contained within Pyre's vaults. Along the way, old friends and new ones will assist the adventurers as they fight their way past living spells and terrifying aberrations known as the grell. With harrowing, easy to run, aerial combats that take place in dark chasms and fire infested pits, this adventure should prove to be exciting for both DMs and players alike.

boardgame.name: The Road to Temptation
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deep in the Balinok Mountains, the winged ruler Alladria struggles to defend the village of Hofburg from a local Orcus cult. With her town overrun by demonic and undead forces, Alladria turns to Count Strahd for aid. Will help arrive in time? If it does, can it overcome the evil forces that await?

This adventure for 5th level characters is set in the Ravenloft Campaign Setting and includes rules for temptation, a new mechanic designed to entice characters into performing evil acts.

boardgame.name: The Eberron Guide to Tomb of Annihilation
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Eberron Guide to Tomb of Annihilation provides Game Masters with all the tools they need to run Tomb of Annihilation in the Eberron Campaign Setting.

User summary:

Tomb of Annihilation is required to use this conversion product.

boardgame.name: Enemies and Allies
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This supplement is perfect for any Dungeon Master who wishes to pit players against virtually any civilization or organization.

With over 70 new humanoids contained herein, your players will be able to find adventure, full of intrigue and danger, at any tier of play.

boardgame.name: Into the Forest of Wyrms: Temple of the Demonic Cult
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Into the Forest of Wyrms Temple of the Demonic Cult is a tier 2 adventure set in the Forgotten Realms. Recommended APL is 5 with 4-6 characters. Characters will advance from level 5 to at least level 8.

The adventure kicks off in Boareskyr Bridge with a caravan escort, making its way to the gnomish town of Hardbuckler, before delving into the Forest of Wyrms. Three side quests with different twists add spice to this adventure: Restless undead from a past battle threaten a farmhouse on the Trade Way; A strange statue with magical tears sought by a wizardess; A gnoll and his family have forsaken their evil God and seek solace and an ability to raise his family in peace.

Fight bandits along the way, feast at the Many Eyed Maw Tavern outside Hardbuckler, and dive into a traditional dungeoncrawl with a twist. Demons from the Abyss, yuan-ti, cult fanatics, and a young green dragon all stand in your path. Behind it all, a strange stone from the Abyss.

boardgame.name: Captain Snowmane's Guided Cruise Through the Domains of Dread
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Captain Snowmane's Guided Cruise Through the Domains of Dread! Captain Snowmane - that's me, and I have the distinct... pleasure of trying to keep you alive on this journey. Don't dangle your hands into the water, for Heavens' sake! In some of these Domains, it might grasp back at you...
...
In this book, we prepared Nine New Domains of Dread to horrify and delight you and your players!

boardgame.name: Red Traitor: 401k
boardgame.description:
Thank you for showing interest in our second game release. These “veteran game mechanics” have been adapted to a “universal” rule set to play a variety of time periods. This book is a stand alone product that does not require any other purchases from us to use your own miniatures collection. Everything you need is right there to play without days of making up your own stuff.

These mechanics been a fun and quick way to play Science Fiction and Modern games with our friends since 2005. We even adapted it to work well in a Victorian “Colonial” setting with a few tweeks. These rules ARE NOT an exact replica of the weapons and equipment of any Era, nor a Hollywood enhancement, but rather to provide a reasonable simulation for enjoyable gameplay.

Quickly about the mechanics... Each figure has a certain number of “actions” each round – in addition they can also react during the enemy’s play. This produces a less static game, but also one that is not so fluid people are never sure where things stand.

This book contains all the Rules you need to play on 4 page large font handy flow chart. As well as a comprehensive Weapons Chart from Spears to Fusion Cannons. In addition are Generic Unit cards you can copy out - or download from our website or facebook - to slip into a standard playing card sleeve for east reference. Not to mention sample Army Lists, Scenarios, and so forth to keep you busy for a little while.

Our goal is to provide you enough material to actually play with, so you do not have to make things up on your own. Our website will contain other fan made products to official support for the game. IE: More scenarios and unit cards.

Thanks to modern publishing techniques, we will be finishing up the following OPTIONAL "Setting Books". Each will include our own world "fluff", specific Unit Cards tailored to the era, Scenarios, and even some old school Terrain tips and Miniature suggestions:


Our "Victorian Era" setting book will cover my favorite Era of play. From 1870 thru the 1930's across those various Historical periods up through World War 1. Even a dash of information if you prefer to play Victorian Science Fiction. It will contain some of my unpublished materials from the "Battlefield: Evolution" book that would have covered this topic.
Our "Science Fiction" setting book will cover man to man, and man to alien, combat in the near and far future. Scenarios and ideas to cover our own Universe, as well as suggestions for your own.
Our "World War 2 to Modern" setting book will cover from World War 2 up till the 1990's. It will handle both the Historical needs of those games, as well as, the ability to play "Pulp" action around your favorite stories and comics with lots of blue and red lasers.
Our "Cthulhu Mythos" setting book will go hand in hand with the "Xothic Wars" products that I co-designed. Each chapter will cover each one of the races covered with Unit Cards, Scenarios, and suggested miniature ranges.
Our "Ancients and Fantasy" setting book will cover things like my favorite Roman historical period, to any range of Fantasy settings and variants.
Our "Black Powder" setting book will cover Samurai, Pirates, and from the Seven Years War up through the American Civil War. It will feature my campaign for the 1860-1962 skirmishes in the American Southwest.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts Weekly: Issue 18
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!
...
The Horrow Lich
New Harvesting Materials
4 New Magical Items To Craft
5 Plot Hooks
The Darkness Within (APL 16)

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts Weekly: Issue 19
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!
...
The Bara Nahgi
New Harvesting Materials
5 New Magical Items To Craft
5 Plot Hooks
A Painful Solution (APL 6)

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!
...
The Fearg
New Harvesting Materials
5 New Magical Items To Craft

Save My Son! (APL 10)

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!
...
The Peripheral Stalker
New Harvesting Materials
5 New Magical Items To Craft

It Strikes From The Other Side (APL 9)

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts Weekly: Issue 22
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!
...
The Infernal Trickster
New Harvesting Materials
4 New Magical Items To Craft
4 Plot Hooks
The Little Trickster (APL 4)

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts Weekly: Issue 23
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!
...
The Hag Shadowstalker
New Harvesting Materials
6 New Magical Items To Craft
4 Plot Hooks
Blood is Thicker Than Promises (APL 5)

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts Weekly: Issue 24
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!
...
The Avatar of the Hunt
New Harvesting Materials
6 New Magical Items To Craft
4 Plot Hooks
Once in a Lifetime (APL 4)

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts Weekly: Issue 25
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Monster Hunts Weekly presents a collection of one-shot adventures, full color maps, new creatures, magical items, plot hooks and harvest tables to quickly inject into your Dungeons and Dragons games!
...
The Pergamind Lizard
New Harvesting Materials
5 New Magical Items To Craft
4 Plot Hooks
Traps and Eggs (APL 5)

boardgame.name: Echoes From Fomalhaut (Issue #08 - Jul 2021)
boardgame.description:
Yrrtwano’s Repose: The great hunter Lord Yrrtwano sleeps uneasy under the ruined husk of Varorlum Manor – if you dare disturb his rest, his enchanted horn may be yours! Dungeon module for 3rd to 4th level characters, 15 keyed loations.
You Meet in a Tavern…: and then what? Start campaigns with a bang using a tried and true cliché!
Castle Sullogh: A fabled castle reputed to be as old as mankind has lived on the Isle of Erillion (and perhaps older), now ruined but not at all abandoned. Four levels with 55 keyed areas containing challenges for 5th to 9th level characters, including a strange museum created by a famous adventuress, a tower of three powerful witches, and an old mystery. Beware the sullogh!
Thasan: Beyond the City of Vultures: Hex-crawl guide to the strange lands of Thasan surrounding the sinful city, describing its burning wastelands, glittering seas, ruined cities and bizarre phantasms in 103 keyed locations.
Also... large-scale maps of Castle Sullogh, the lands of Thasan, and a colour player’s hex map of the Isle of Erillion!
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Lava Fjords
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Embers rise in sizzling waves of heat from the pools of lava below. It flows in from a volcano somewhere higher above, running down in rivulets between rocky stone outcrops.

Blackened and scorched boulders are illuminated eerily in the red light, rubble forming mounds at their base. They form partial cliffs as they overlook this fjord of lava.

boardgame.name: The Burning Maw
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Intense heat and the smell of bubbling sulfur waft out of this jagged rocky gully where a stream of molten slag slowly makes its way down the mountain side. Embers makes towards the sky blackening the rocks closest to the lava flow before disappearing before your eyes.

boardgame.name: Daggertooth Beach
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The ocean laps against pristine sand, which rises to join soft, mossy grasses and rocky outcrops towering over the beach. The stones are overgrown with a leafy groundcover, wildflowers, and swaying palm trees.
You can hear the cries of seagulls and albatross as they circle overhead.

boardgame.name: The Dagger Reef
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sunlight ripples on the seafloor, where stone outcrops rise to tower over clumps of seaweed and colourful corals. Schools of fish dart in and out between them.
Something doesn’t feel right.

boardgame.name: Dragon Mountain River
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A blue, babbling river winds its way through this gully. Jagged rocky outcrops tower over the water. They are grown over with bushes, wildflowers and sparse trees.
Birds sing as they dart between the greenery. Further away you can hear the echoing call of a stag.

boardgame.name: Wyrmtooth Gully
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wagon wheel ruts cut through the road as it winds its way through this gully. Jagged rocky outcrops tower over those below, grown over with bushes, wildflowers and sparse trees.
Birds sing as they dart between the greenery. Further away you can hear the white noise of a river.

boardgame.name: Frozen Maw Pass
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wagon wheel ruts cut through the snow-covered road as it winds its way through this frozen pass. Jagged rocky outcrops tower over those below, grown over with snow-laden bushes and sparse trees.
The wind howls loudly as it passes through, rustling the surrounding brush. Nearby you can hear the thumping of a hare as it warns of danger.

boardgame.name: Deadwind Canyon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wagon wheel ruts cut through the dusty road as it winds its way through this desert canyon. Jagged rocky outcrops tower over those below, covered with shale and dry bushes.
The silence is so loud here it roars in your ears like white noise.

boardgame.name: Infernal Arena
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Lava cracks like shards of glass as it laps against islands of bone, overlooked by a skeleton throne far above this infernal arena.
Steel spikes and sharpened stakes line the walls, preventing gladiators from climbing to escape. Two stairwells lead down to the arena, splashed with blood and sealed with barred gates—though one only meets with molten lava.
Stone pews overlook the arena for a bloodthirsty audience, alongside skulls with flaming sockets. Within the arena itself are scorched bridges connecting the isles, and tall pillars with sharpened spikes for combatants to utilize.

Adventure Seed

A wizard will pay you a small fortune to travel into the plane of fire. There you will acquire a magically enhanced flaming dagger from a djinn Lord. The wizard says he wants you to do whatever is necessary to get it, before opening a portal for you. You will, of course, be paid AFTER you have acquired the goods and returned to the material plane—adventurers are notorious for taking gold and, ahem, leaving.

When you step through the portal, you arrive at the entrance to a giant obsidian castle and salamander guards surround you. They escort you to the djinn Lord, who says that to receive the dagger you must first defeat his champions in the arena.

If you defeat them, the greatly pleased djinn applauds loudly from his throne above the arena as the wizard steps out of the shadows behind him. The djinn thanks him for his contributions, saying the gladiators have performed as promised. He hands the dagger to the wizard, who grins before teleporting back to the material plane.

WHAT’S HAPPENING? The wizard has sold your party as gladiators in exchange for the dagger, without telling you.
If you try to kill the djinn, he will summon a fire elemental to fight for him. If you defeat that, he will cast invisibility and attempt to flee (he was previously trapped for many years and will vehemently resist it happening again).

If you negotiate with the djinn he will be reluctant to release his best champions yet—unless of course you recover an item of even greater value from the wizard. Something he’s had his eyes on for a while now… If you agree to recover it for him, the djinn will open a portal for you, after branding you magically so he knows where you are until you fulfill your deal.

boardgame.name: Pirate Lord's Arena
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A stream drains out to the ocean over mounds of bones from fallen gladiators. Islands of stone and rubble rise above the skeletons, decorated with pillars of sharpened stakes and flaming skulls. Far above this pirate lord’s arena sits a bone throne, overlooking the growing bloodshed within it.
Steel spikes and sharpened stakes line the walls, preventing gladiators from climbing to escape. On the other side of the stadium foams the ocean, filled with shipwrecks from fallen vessels. Two stairwells lead down to the arena, splashed with blood and sealed with barred gates.
Stone pews overlook the arena for a bloodthirsty audience, alongside skulls with flaming sockets. Within the arena itself are rickety wooden bridges, connecting the isles. One of them leads out into the ocean.

boardgame.name: NFT: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
NFT: The Card Game is a satirical push-your-luck game for 2-5 players.

Outbid the other players to purchase NFTs. Be the first to collect 11 or more joy to win. Avoid sending 3 species of the same rarity score extinct.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Arena of Slaughter
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Blood puddles between mounds of bones from fallen gladiators. Islands of stone and rubble rise above them, decorated with pillars of sharpened stakes and flaming skulls. Far above this arena of slaughter sits a skeleton throne, overlooking the growing carnage within it.
Steel spikes and sharpened stakes line the walls, preventing gladiators from climbing to escape. Two stairwells lead down to the arena, splashed with blood and sealed with barred gates.
Stone pews overlook the arena for a bloodthirsty audience, alongside skulls with flaming sockets. Within the arena itself are giant blades forming bridges between the isles. Like so much else, they, too, are stained with blood.

boardgame.name: Arena of Rot
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Green bile pools between mounds of bones from fallen gladiators. Islands of stone and fleshy growths rise above them, decorated with pillars of sharpened stakes and skulls. Far above this arena of rot sits a skeleton throne, overlooking the decomposing flesh within it.
Steel spikes and sharpened stakes line the walls, preventing gladiators from climbing to escape. Two stairwells lead down to the arena, splashed with blood and sealed with barred gates.
Stone pews overlook the arena for a bloodthirsty audience, alongside skulls with flaming sockets. Fleshy growths sprawl beneath the seats, while in the arena itself they form unsteady bridges between the stone islands.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A pool of green bile seeps over mounds of bones from fallen gladiators. Islands of stone and fleshy growths rise above it, decorated with pillars of sharpened stakes and skulls. Far above this arena of rot sits a skeleton throne, overlooking the rising bile within it.
Steel spikes and sharpened stakes line the walls, preventing gladiators from climbing to escape. Two stairwells lead down to the arena, splashed with blood and sealed with barred gates.

boardgame.name: Underwater Arena
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Stone “islands” formed of stone and covered with bones of fallen gladiators rise above ink black mounds of skeletons below. Corals and seaweed grow on the structures while fish dart amongst them. Far above a skeleton throne overlooks this underwater arena.
Steel spikes and sharpened stakes line the walls, preventing gladiators from climbing to escape. Two stairwells lead down to the arena, sealed with barred gates.
Stone pews overlook the arena for a bloodthirsty audience, alongside more skulls. Many have died here, and many more will continue to do so.

boardgame.name: Trackless Fens Treetop Bridges
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Wooden treetop bridges pass over this swamp. Puddles of fetid water lay stagnant over thick mud far below, while bugs swarm around bushes and dying trees. A small stream fills the stinking pools, flowing in from a steep cliff before slowing to a halt in the marshes below.

The stench of rotting decay rises from the oozing mud and strange, flowering undergrowth. Roots from trees reach out of the mud like clawing hands, grasping for sunlight they haven’t seen in years…

Adventure Seed

While traveling along the boardwalk in a swamp, you hear hoarse cries from a woman and some men, begging for help. Catching sight of them you see four people tied against a large tree with rope as thick as your fist. Their lower halves are submerged in the water, their clothes torn and caked in mud. Smaller ropes tying their wrists dappled in blood.

When they see you they beg you to help them. They woke up here after passing through a village and eating dinner at the tavern, their possessions gone. They have no idea where they are or why, but urge you to hurry as they’ve been awake for hours.

By the time you make it off the bridge and down to where they are, a snake as thick as a man and longer than the group combined emerges from the swampy undergrowth. Its tongue flickers out of its mouth as if it can already taste its next meal.

WHAT’S HAPPENING? Once every year a nearby village drugs passers through, before tying them up unconscious as a sacrifice to the gigantic snake. They’ve been doing this ever since they realized how, if the snake overeats, it sleeps for the rest of the year.

Originally the villager’s own small population was the animal’s prey. Their children would disappear from the village, or travelers through the swamp would never return. Since they started their annual sacrifices, though terrible, far less people die.

boardgame.name: Elagosk's Shattered Frozen Lake
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Broken ice floats precariously above a lake, fed by a stream of flowing water. It runs along the edges of the pebble banks, waiting for unwary adventurers.

Rising outcrops of stone are lightly dusted with snow. Frozen undergrowth crunches with every step, while mounds of rubble make the ground even more treacherous.

Around you the trees loom tall, snow sprinkling down from their leaves as the wind rustles through them. Small flower blossoms wait to melt under the promising kiss of sunlight.
